page.title: 02GAZETTEER 2
page.content:
In original Domesday times both Sevington and South Ashford are mentioned.
The flood plain is seeing the 'development' of Ashford; factory sites are spreading at South Willesborough, where more flat land is designated for railway development related to the Channel Tunnel, and in South Ashford the Ellingham Farm complex has 130 new factory units available. This butts straight on to the sheep grazing land.
Apart from the villages, housing is scattered, being mainly farm (or ex_farm) houses and cottages, now often taken over by commuters.
